trans-unit.source: Represents the major and minor tick marks along an axis.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark> class encapsulates the functionality for all chart tick marks.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark> class is exposed as the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.MajorTickMark%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.MinorTickMark%2A> properties of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis> objects.
By default, major tick marks are displayed at the major grid lines, whereas minor tick marks must be explicitly displayed.
MajorTickMark.Interval is not set (`Double.NaN`) by default, and the tick marks are drawn according to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Interval%2A>.
MinorTickMark.Interval is set to `Auto` (`0`) by default, and the Chart control automatically determines the interval.
A developer can use this class to:
Enable or disable tick marks.
Set the color, width, length and line style of tick marks.
Specify a style that determines whether tick marks are displayed outside the axis, inside the axis or across the axis.
Specify the starting point—where the first tick mark is drawn—as well as the tick mark interval, which correlates to their frequency.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the length of tick marks.
The length is measured in units that represent a percentage of the height or width of the chart image, depending on the axis.
The size of a tick mark determines the tick mark's length.
The `Size` property is measured in units that represent a percentage of the height or width of the chart image.
If the tick mark is displayed along a vertical axis, the unit of measure is a percentage of the chart image's width.
If the tick mark is displayed along a horizontal axis, the unit of measure is a percentage of the chart image's height.
A change in the width of the chart image will result in the resizing of all tick marks displayed along vertical axes, for all chart areas.
Similarly, a change in the height of the chart image will result in the resizing of all tick marks displayed along horizontal axes, for all chart areas.

To display tick marks for three-dimensional (3D) charts, so that they are just drawn for the width of a wall, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.TickMarkStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMarkStyle.AcrossAxis> and specify a tick mark size of zero (0) using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.Size%2A> property.
A `float` value that represents the size, or length, of tick marks.
The default value is 1.0 percent.
Gets or sets the tick mark style.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.TickMarkStyle%2A> property determines the style of tick marks.
Tick marks can be drawn inside the chart area, outside the chart area, across an axis line, or can be disabled.

To display tick marks for three-dimensional (3D) charts, so that they are just drawn for the width of a wall, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.TickMarkStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMarkStyle.AcrossAxis>.
Then specify a tick mark size of zero (0) using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.Size%2A> property.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMark.TickMarkStyle%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMarkStyle.None?displayProperty=fullName>, tick marks are not displayed.
Tick marks can also be toggled on or off by setting the [Tickmark.Enabled](<xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Grid.Enabled%2A>) property to `true` or `false`.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMarkStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.TickMarkStyle.OutsideArea"></xref>.
